I would probably give it 4 stars once they fix up the set up so it's more intuitive how to go about buying your rolled ice cream. :)
author: Brandon L.

description: Love love love this place. Been once and it was really great. The service was awesome and the staff are friendly. Cookies and cream is kinda my thing lol. They do it well here. I know someone who goes there a bit more on the regular and he likes them a LOT. Their was talk of pumpkin pie being added but I have no clue if that happened. I will have to check into that lol. Eggnog is probably another good one for the holidays. Anyhow it's a great spot and you should try it out. Support local businesses.
author: Bella B.

description:
Be warned! It does take a while to get your ice cream. 
My friend and I decided to go this morning because I've been dying to try some rolled ice cream after seeing it all over instagram and they finally have one in SF! We got Thai Chee, a Thai tea and lychee blend ice cream. It was suuuuuper yummy! The lychee definitely brings out the flavor. One of the best part is being able to add your own toppings at no charge probably because it's $7-8 bucks for their ice cream. Although we were the 5th customer and had to wait about 10-15 mins, I think it was worth the wait considering that there was only one person making the ice cream rolls and I would expect his arms to be tired chopping and rolling allllllla that ice cream. Other the that the service was great and the workers are friendly!
author: Melissa A.

description:
Ok, the s'mores flavor is my absolute favorite, but honestly you really can't go wrong. They're all incredible. I love the straight matcha with condensed milk and strawberries too!!! Can't get enough of it.

Go early as there tend to be huge lines at the end of the day. I always get a Small because I can never finish a large.
author: Maryam T.

description:
My husband and I with our small group of friends were visiting SF for a week.  We just finished lunch across the street with some local friends and stumbled across this place on the way to our car.  We decided to give it a shot.  

I agree with the other reviews that the ice cream was pretty dense considering that it was "rolled".  The flavor was definitely there, but what turned me off was that there was a girl there prepping the ice cream.  She was wearing disposable food gloves, but she picked up her phone and tried to call someone, then placed the phone back on the counter, then she started to scratch her face with the same glove...and eventually she brushed her hair out of her face with it and finally returning to the ice cream.  I was so GROSSED out by it that I had to step out of the place.  Just no.
author: Mary T.

description: There are a lot of roll ice cream places in SF, and this sure is one of them! It is, however, cheaper than most similar vendors, and with a better-than-normal selection of toppings. I particularly appreciate the fresh berries and boba-style lychee jelly. The flavors are interesting -- my fave is the banana and nutella one -- and they're made pretty quickly. The only real complaint I have is that roll ice cream is hard to eat, especially with a spoon rather than chopsticks. If any roll ice cream vendor can solve that issue, they will have all my money.
author: Shawn W.

description:
This is my second time coming here & it has slightly changed. I am a really big fan of rolled ice cream and I have to say I really enjoyed the Thai Chee the first time around, much more. During my visit the second time around, I noticed that when they add the Lychee, it's one small piece. The first time I came here, they were really generous with the additions into the rolled ice cream. The rolled ice cream definitely still has it's amazing taste, however there are some downsides, such as service and lack of structure. Some of the workers didn't seem to know what they were doing and were slightly confused. My friend checked in and wanted to use the Yelp discount promotion and the young man helping us at the register was unsure of how to use this promo. This definitely was a bit shocking, as you'd expect every person working the register to be up to date with current promos and how they are to go about entering them. In addition, it was quite upsetting that they would literally use one piece of fruit to mix in with the ice cream base. Example: One slice of a banana, one cube of chocolate, one chunk of mango. 

Although there were many people waiting for their orders, it was a little unusual to see how much this place has changed over such a short period of time. I really do hope that they read their reviews and improve on the negative aspects.
author: Julia K.

description: This place is very similar to Icicles in San Jose   in taste and in style. The ice cream is made in front of you from a cream placed on a cold plate and the workers roll the ice cream. I got their matcha flavor (all ice cream flavors are $7.05 with tax included) and had crushed oreos, lychee jelly, and a condensed milk drizzle as my toppings - all toppings are included in that one price too! I really liked the ice cream from this place - just a heads up that this store is very small and they have limited seating (just a few benches next to the walls and no tables) so if you plan to come here on a nice sunny weekend like I did, you might want to go somewhere else to actually eat your ice cream since there probably won't be much space inside! Oh also the portions they give are pretty large, so the one cup was good enough for both a friend and I to share.
author: Danielle S.

description:
I ordered #8 and #2 
The presentation is beautiful!! Different compared to typical ice cream since it is flattened and rolled once mixed with toppings of your choice 

Pros:
The ice cream was super rich and delicious!
Best was definitely #8 - the chocolate ice cream with Carmel was so creamy. 

The toppings were fresh (I tried: marshmellows, almonds, Carmel, chocolate chips, chocolate covered wafer) 

The staff was friendly and the shop was clean 

Cons:
The process of making the ice cream took a while 
 the prices run on the higher side (comparable to marble slab) 
 
Overall, a delicious and beautiful dessert that is enjoyed by all  I'll definitely be going back!
author: Lindsey G.

description: I don't know why people opt to wait in long lines to pay exorbitant prices to eat artificially-tasting chopped-up frozen cream. It doesn't even have the taste or texture of real ice cream. If you thought Coldstone's topping mix-ins were labor-intensive, you've never seen rolled ice cream before. "But you get unlimited free toppings!" you say. If you want to pay $5-7 for toppings and icy frozen scraped cream, more power to you. Put it on Instagram because memories of the your dessert being made will be the best part of the whole experience.
author: May L.

description: Rolled Ice Cream changes the game. Went in not expecting much just typical Ice Cream. We got the cookies and cream ice cream and WOW. I did not expect ice cream to taste that good. We saw it being made right in front of house and it tasted fresh as you possibly can get. Hands down the best ice cream Ive ever had so far. Theres a school nearby so I recommend you go either before the school is out or after when the kids are all home cause it can get extremely busy!
author: Navdeep D.

description: Okay, I'm in. I'm sad that J.J.'s is gone, but Thai-rolled ice cream, I do enjoy your presence in my mouth. Master ube? Yes, I'll have some more. Chopped purple yam combined with ube flavor and vanilla ice cream base, all diced and smoothed out on that super cold plate and then scraped into perfectly purple rolls. Top it off with some mochi and pretzels, and you're going to be licking your lips. MMM, MMM! The only downside is that it's $7.05 for a regular size. Little steep, but delicious nonetheless.
author: Danny C.

description: I love love this place it is the best rolled treat in the bay everyone has to try this place out I am addicted to the funky monkey
author: G G.

description: I've had rolled ice cream before. This was too cold to where spooning it out was difficult. Ambience of place was nice. Servers were very helpful.
author: Aaron R.

description: I came here on a Saturday evening and it was packed, but the line goes fast and you get to watch them mix and roll the ice cream on the spot for you. There's not much seating, but people usually eat and leave so turn around is too bad. I rounded up my rating of 3.5 to a 4 stars because there was more good than bad here. We ordered the strawberry cheesecake and got to see them chop and mix the vanilla ice cream milk with a small slice of strawberry and cheesecake. The toppings are free and unlimited - so we added pocky, strawberries, raspberries, and mochi. Quite tasty and love the little bits of strawberry and cheesecake in every bite. It's around $5 for a small, which is a perfect size for me after dinner. Definitely want to return for the matcha and Thai tea with lychee!
author: Amanda C.

description:
unlimited toppings, kind service and the better rolled ice cream logistics that i've seen. 

When you first get here, it's a little scary that there is a line out the door. But when you get closer, you realize that they're just waiting to pay first thing and the cashier is really close to the door. bring a jacket. you will be outside waiting. 

I love that their toppings are unlimited. They have a variety of cookies, fruit, nuts, sauces, cereals and other things like that. I am going to take a star off because they didn't have mochi!! It's okay though. my ice cream still came out delicious. you pick toppings after your ice cream is rolled. 

I ordered the matcha and topped it with a wafer, cap'n crunch cereal, condensed milk and strawberries. It was super yummy. I love hard ice creams so this is totally my thing. 

They got a pretty good system going with three different people rolling and a small space to sit or watch or wait. the cashier i had was super kind. she explained things clearly and even went outside when people didn't come in to pick up their ice cream.
author: Tina Y.

description: The Master Ube was tasty with toppings of Mochi, graham cracker, and shaved coconut. The flavor of the ice cream itself was average, the ube was utterly lost amongst the vanilla base and the fact that the Ice cream is chilled colder than average Ice cream temperatures in order to get the product rolling, makes for dull flavors. 3 stars for this innovative novelty, that is fun to watch being made!
author: Janelle D.

description: I had something similiar to this place in SoCal, So i didn't have much expectations to this place.  They have different types of flavors, like smores, matcha, thai tea, berries, and more.  I ended up with thai tea and added graham crackers and condense milk drizzle.  The ice cream is made on this flat pan that's cold and they use a scraper to roll it up.  But the taste of it is no different from ice cream. It's fancy and instagram worthy, so most of us will pay for that food for the pic.  But i won't get too hype up on it.  The thai tea flavor was good and had a strong tea taste.  Next  time i'll try the Matcha and smore one
author: Belinda C.

description: We came here during one of the hottest weekends in San Francisco. I ordered the mangoaway, and added matcha, strawberry syrup, and a vanilla wafer straw. My boyfriend got the strawberry cheesecake and added a pocky stick and white chocolate syrup. It was nice that all the additional ingredients were free of charge. It was a long wait to receive our orders, even when it was pretty empty. However, the employees were nice and overall, the ice cream tasted good. The only downside was that there was not a lot of space inside to eat and no place outside. It was not the best place I have had rolled ice cream, but it was still very good.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Delicious, but overhyped. I came in with the expectations relatively high, however while the ice cream making concept is pretty cool, it is relatively similar to regular ice cream. It is also not the cheapest. I ordered a large cup ($7.05) because I was sharing it with one other person and after eating it, we didn't think it was worth $7. Maybe $5 but definitely not $7. 

I went on a Thursday afternoon so there was little to now wait. They have a reasonable amount of ice cream flavors to choose from and an unlimited amount of toppings to go with it. I ordered the matcha ice cream with condensed milk, mocha, and an s'mores marshmallow on top. They didn't put a lot of toppings on it, so definitely ask for more! Overall, it was definitely a cool concept and a cool experience but it's not something I would ever really crave for or frequently go to.
author: Victoria H.

description: Ice cream isnt bad. The only problem is that this place is overhyped and the ice cream and toppings itself isnt sweet. I ordered the 3x berry and it was alright. It tastes like a frozen smoothie you can make at home. The process they use to make ice cream and the people that work there are very kind.
author: John M.

description: I've been here about 2x and I can say I really enjoy their rolled ice cream. You can get an unlimited amount of toppings as well. You just can't get any refill. They make your rolled ice cream right in front of you so you can watch them. It is rly filling though so if you already ate you should prolly share with someone
author: Alyssa P.

description: My friends and I came on a Monday around 7PM and we waited about 30 minutes for them to make when it was not even crowded...It taste good, but the wait is a bit ridiculous just for a desert. Nothing too special...
author: Darlene T.

description: Decided to have an ice cream after we ate dinner with friends. And WOOOOOW it was so yummy. Had a master UBE and it was extremely good. Wanna go back to try more with unli toppings.
author: Smile B.

description: Excellent service with unlimited toppings for a wonderful experience. Only cons are long wait time and the place is crowded and 100 degrees inside.
author: Michael C.

description: Very similar to icicles. However, this place has better options for toppings, they also cut up fresh fruit for you if you'd like. It was fun to watch the workers make my ice cream. Although I think I would've liked it if they gave me a little bit more strawberries and Nutella on my Cookie Monster ice cream.
author: Sharon L.

description: I came in around 8:30pm on a Friday night and the line wasn't as bad as I thought. I was really satisfied with how good the matcha was. It had a strong matcha taste that many places seem to lack and it wasn't too sweet either. Kinda wish they made the rolls bigger since I'm paying $7 (pretty pricey for ice cream).
author: Chris M.

description: I checked this spot out with my siblings over the weekend. My brother raved about it and I've never had rolled up ice cream before and I know it's the newest dessert sensation so I wanted to give it a try. I was totally impressed! I ordered the Ube and it was so flavorful. It's just a thicker form of ice cream, which was a little difficult to eat plus it felt like I was going to break my plastic spoon. Nevertheless, I enjoyed mine. We also tried the Thai Tea with Lychee, Oreo, and the Nutella Banana which was also one of the best. The line wasn't too long nor was the wait on a Sunday evening around 5pm. Not sure why everyone's complaining about the wait. Its a small spot and rolled ice cream is the current hype, what else do you expect?
author: Dara S.

description: I really wanted to try rolled ice cream. So today l went out with my friends just to try this! The place was nice and clean. I got the Cookie Monster with mochi, strawberries, blueberries, pocky sticks, and wafer sticks. The first bite that I ate, OMG CAN I TELL YOU! This can be one of the best ice creams I've ever tasted! The cream isn't too sweet which I think that they made it themselves. When you dig into the ice cream, it is very frozen. I somewhat like that texture of ice cream. There is a variety of toppings which you can choose as much as you want. The ice cream is awesome and great for taking Instagram worthy pictures!
author: Carrie L.

description:
I'm from Seattle so we don't have a lot of these, if any, around so I was excited to try out rolled ice cream. I was a bit confused on how to order because the first thing you see is a big board of the toppings and then another smaller board that has "fixed options" (I.e. Menu items you can just order that include what's listed) and then there's another small board with what type of ice cream flavors there are. I didn't know how to order correctly and even after asking one of the workers.

The staff were friendly but a bit slow on service given that there weren't many people there when I went. And even when a big group poured in afterwards (not such a good idea since the space is tight and not a lot of room for people to move about when it's busy) they still worked at the same pace. 

I wouldn't mind coming back here, but I'd probably go out of my way to find a different place for rolled ice cream. This would be a more 2nd/3rd option spot for me.
author: Jessica D.

description: Definitely a fun experience to watch your ice cream being made! The Ice cream rolls ranges in price from $5-$7 for small and large size, with as many toppings as you'd like.  Remember that they make each ice cream by hand so it will take some time, even if they aren't busy.
author: Mandy B.

description:
3.5 stars. 
Small place with limited seating. Got the popular choice- Cookie Monster (cookies and cream). Didn't realize you can choose any toppings you want. The cashier is super friendly and helpful, but the guy doing the toppings wasn't that nice. When asking about toppings he was so whatever and it was a bit hard to see all the options. I just got a Pocky stick, chocolate roll and some whipped cream. I felt a bit rushed. I enjoyed the ice cream, but service needs to be worked on a bit, especially for first timers not knowing what to expect.
author: Karen H.

description:
They often have a line of people waiting, sometimes out to the door.  I now know why....

It was a Sunday afternoon, I  ordered the Match Cream at about 3:40pm, at 4:10pm they called number 75, then 76.  I showed them my order number was 74.  Apparently, my order was either missed or someone else took my order.  They do not ask for your ticket when you walk up to pick up your order.  I finally got my order at about 4:20pm. 

I don't mind waiting for something that is worth the wait, but the ice cream rolls didn't have a lot of flavor. A pint of ice cream from Andronico's may have been a better choice for me.  

It would have been helpful if it was made known to the customer the expected wait time.  I would have left  if I had not already paid $7 plus dollars for my order.  I would understand a 10-15 minute wait, but not a 40 minute wait and I felt it was over priced for the amount and quality of what I received. 

Kudos to the guys making the ice cream rolls, I can tell they were working very hard to keep up with the orders.
author: mimi c.

description:
Rolled ice cream is very cool and I liked the texture- I personally really like chewy/crunchy/not just soft ice cream kind of ice creams so the texture was perfect for me.


I got cookies n crème and my boyfriend got coffee. I thought it tasted pretty good- a bit sweet but overall a very nice treat, good portion too. It might not be something that I will ever crave though to be honest. 

The staffs were really friendly and patient, the line was really long and it was really crowded- I would say environment might not be their forte but the line moved pretty fast and everyone was greeted with a smile.

If you've never had rolled ice cream you should definitely give it a try! Let's roll!
author: Alyssa H.

description: Came here a couple of times, and ordered the Master Ube. I love the texture and flavor of the ice cream, their stamp card reward system, and the fact that you can get unlimited toppings. What I DON'T love, is that the staff was too busy chitchatting and making their music playlist instead of making orders. :( The wait wouldn't have been that long if there was less socializing and more work done.
author: Elaine L.

description:
Ok so where else can you watch your icecream actually being made? Ive been here a few times now and keep wanting more, could be my love of free unlimited toppings but I suspect its that and the ice cream is good.
So a few things to know if you go, 1st is to expect a wait (not that long if its contained inside and not out the door) 2 they have only 2 sizes small= $5.42 and large $7 something.
Once you have decided size then its flavors, they have a dozen choices to choose from.
You pay them, you wait for your number to be called or go stand by the guys scraping up the mixtures (prolly one of the best parts is to watch them make it).
Then it goes to the front for toppings which is when they call your number.
I have yet to test them on how far they will go with the "unlimited toppings" part as you dont get a lot of time before the next persons order is ready.
So i also suggest you have your choices made in your mind prior to being called up. It is also a good idea while your waiting to imagine the order of what toppings you want applied as it matters, at least to me. See ya there maybe as i will no doutedly be back.
author: Drew F.

description:
I just wanted some ice cream and had no idea they roll the stuff.  I found it gimmicky and didn't like the wait;  this is even with only two people in front of me.  I just wanted my ice cream scooped and leave with it.  I hate to imagine the 40min waits other people mentioned when there's been lines.  I didn't find the ice cream to be all that special so won't be back.  
I do want to say the sign up front with the boston terrier is super cute.
author: Animal K.

description:
yes! I am a fan! came on a recommendation from a friend, who actually hadn't been yet but heard of the place, but I digress..... 

my little family was gracious enough to indulge my craving for rolled ice cream. I've seen it everywhere and had yet to try it, so on a whim we decided to go to Let's Roll. The previous reviews were right about the wait. Was fast to order but waiting for the ice cream itself took a while BUT WORTH. THE. WAIT!! 

There's something to be said about ice cream being made FRESH, right in front of you and then given the option for unlimited toppings! C'mon now. LOL 

I had the Thai Chee - loved the little bits of lychee mixed in with the thai tea ice cream.
the hubby and son had the cookies and cream one - yumm!! to quote the husband,  "this $#!TS on every other cookies and cream ice cream I've had before!" LOL 
my plain jane daughter had the vanilla, which was also very good. 

all in all would come back to try the other flavors. Just make sure you have the time to wait.
author: StaceyRose G.

description: Soft and delicious. Let's roll is yummy and has lots of different choices! They also have free and UNLIMITED !
author: Jo C.

description: Pretty and satisfying treat! I had the rocky road with mochi, almonds, white chocolate sauce, pocky, toasted marshmallow.  Last time I was here I had the Master Ube and it was just ok.  Definitely get a rewards card if you plan on coming back for more. For a busy place the service is good and the staff is friendly.  Be prepared to wait in line long as everyone here already mentioned.
author: Y P.

description:
I am a fan. At first I thought it would be all hype, but it packed lots of flavor and stayed frozen til the end. 

Heard about rolled ice cream and seen them all over my feed for months. Family came to town and after some fun at Golden Gate Park, decided on a treat. We got very lucky, and beat the evening rush. We still had a bit of a wait, but nothing like the line after we ordered. 

You order at the front, and based on my # I knew when it was our turn and called the kids up to watch their ice cream being made. Entertaining and delicious, can't beat that!

We had the Strawberry Cheesecake, 3xBerries and Cookie Monster. All were delicious. The big plus was the unlimited toppings! It may be pricey to some $7 for a regular, but your paying for made to order ice cream and toppings. 

I'd definitely be back again, soon!
author: Crystal A.

description: A little small the only nice person is the cashier the workers just talk to each other in the back. The ice cream looks better than it tastes not bad but probably wouldn't go back again. Pretty cool that you can have unlimited toppings though!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
This ice cream shop is located at a nice neighborhood. The lines are ultimately what drive my decision for my 3-star review. I ordered a Mocha Matcha.

The quality of the ice cream is great, however, the toppings were lacking. The bananas were really tiny for the price point. 

After a 45 minute wait after my initial purchase, I finally get what I paid for. I think they are going to need a few more rolling stations to keep up with the demand.
author: Matthew C.

description:
The only other experience in my lifetime that I can compare this to is lining up for free stuff on a college campus. Crowded, and a lot of people mulling over whether or not they made a grave mistake by deciding to commit to the wait.

When asked how long the wait would be? "About half an hour," they said. The truth? Over an hour. Not including the 5-7 minutes I waited in line. 

I got the Thai Chee (Thai tea base + lychee), and it's pretty good. It's nice that your topping choices are unlimited, but they ran out of raspberries. No bother. I got a strawberry, a lychee, some blueberries, whipped cream, and a condensed milk drizzle. It would've been nice if the strawberries and lychees were cut up or sliced, as strawberries and lychees are generally quite large. 

I also got a large, 20oz chocolate milkshake, pretty standard. 

The staff were generally pretty friendly, though lacking. They need to hire more staff. If only they were able to get orders out faster. 

For $6.50 for the rolled ice cream (which might be a promo price for the time being?) and $5.50 for the large milkshake, it's not bad, but not worth the wait. A good one time experience, but I'd rather go elsewhere for ice cream.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
As everyone else has mentioned, be prepared for a wait. I remember when the place first opened, there was always a line out the door, so I thought we were in good shape when there were only 3 parties in front of us at the register. Turned out it was quick to order, but then we waited almost 30 minutes for our ice cream.

Regardless of the wait though, I think the ice cream is great! I didn't realize they chopped up the ice cream ingredients on the spot and then mixed it in before flattening it out and rolling it. I got the funky monkey, and the hubby got strawberry cheesecake. I loved the nutella shavings in mine! Both flavors were tasty on their own accord, but the free, unlimited toppings were a nice perk.

I would definitely come back (especially now that the closer ice cream shop to us, Swich, has closed.. sad face), but will be more strategic about when I go to avoid the wait (maybe the middle of the day?).
author: Cha V.

description: My first time trying rolled ice cream left me wanting more! Delicious flavors, highly customizable, and a fun new way to try your favorite dessert. If you have never had it before it is definitely worth a try!
author: Noah P.

description: Honestly one of my favorite ice cream shops ever. Check out my article about them for Spoon University for more details why (https://spoonuniversity.com/place/thai-rolled-ice-cream-comes-to-san-francisco).
author: Kelsey T.

description:
This is the second time that I've been to a rolled ice cream spot. The first time was in Vegas and I had a great experience! To be honest, I don't like the way everything is set up here. It is a super small place and this place gets really busy. 

My boyfriend and I came on Monday right when they opened and they had a line forming 10 minutes after they opened. When you walk in, you order first. So instead of picking a base and toppings, you pick a combo from their menu. I think a lot of people don't know that you can still customize it which I think is the best part. After you order, you wait for your number to be called. Then you can put unlimited toppings on top. For me, I had the chunky monkey which is nutella and banana but I also added and oreo into mine. MHM, delicious if you like nutella and banana! 

Overall, the experience was okay. Their ice cream is pretty good though.
author: Joey C.

description: I came at such a great time 4:15pm ish just right after the rush came. I would suggest coming early Incase you don't feel like waiting too long. There's only about 3 workers on a Saturday night. One at each station, resister, making the rolled ice cream and one at the toppings bar. Btw, toppings are FREE! Love this place!
author: Laura D.

description: Only serving Bud's ice cream for now.  Will come back for their thai styled rolled ice cream (they said their machine will come in 2 weeks).
author: Daniel S.

description:
This is the first time I've eaten rolled ice cream. This is a new place so when I drive past it, I knew I had to try it. When you get in the menu isn't really clear. There are a good amount of flavors. This week it was $6.50 instead of $7. 
After you order you can go look at how they make it because they made it fresh. We ordered Cookie Monster and Thai Chee and Mócha Matcha. It took them about 3 minutes to make it. IT WAS REALLY COOL! 
After you get unlimited toppings for FREE. There was chocolate syrup, raspberry syrup, melted white chocolate, cookies, and way more. 
After while we were eating, the manager came and talked to us. He talked about how he tried to use the fruit that is in season. He was really nice. 
The reason I gave it four stars is because the Mócha Matcha still wasn't perfected yet.  
Overall, I am definitely coming back to try new flavors!! You should come too!!
author: Food Snob G.

description: This place is great, the employees were so friendly and made me a brand new rolled ice cream option that wasn't on the menu yet called Smores. I'll post a pic of it here on Yelp. The toppings are free, I didn't go too crazy with them but maybe I will next time lol. You can watch them roll the ice cream while you're there...pretty cool! My friend got the Cookies and Cream option. I tried it and it was delicious as well. I think I liked it more than mine but they were both excellent. The great service made the experience so much better. We came at an off time so didn't have to wait too long but it started getting busy as we were leaving so you might have to wait a bit when you go. We would go back, it was a fun new-to-us way to enjoy ice cream. :-)
author: Freaky P.

description: Finally a rolled ice cream shop in the city. I've been wanting to try rolled ice cream for a while but didn't want to drive too far for it. So I was pretty excited when I found out that Let's Roll just opened up in my neighborhood. My husband and I went this afternoon and we got lucky because we beat the crowd of kids that just got off of school. We ordered the Cookie Monster and the Thai Chee both with toppings. While we waited for our rolled ice cream we enjoyed watching the staff carefully creating our orders. It's such a unique technique to make yummy ice cream. Over all the customer service was excellent and we enjoyed our first taste of rolled ice cream with unlimited toppings. We will definitely be back with our family and friends to try the rest of the delicious flavors.
author: Aida T.

description: Our tween daughter convinced us to try rolled ice cream. If you like very heavy, rich tastes, this style may appeal. For us, it was too sweet and rich, we will stick to fro yo.
author: Mia N.

description:
Walked in after a meal at San Tung for dessert. Since it was 20 minutes before closing time, there was not much of a wait. The cashier was waiting for us to order.

I ordered a small Thai Chee. It came out to be $5.42. I gave the cashier $5.50 since I could deal with the change. But he just stood there and told me repeatedly that it was $5.42, even raising his voice at me after I gave him 2 more cents. The worker who was at the toppings station even looked over. He could have just taken my money and given me change, but instead was incredibly rude and made me confused. Customer service could be improved.

The ice cream was great and did not melt fast. Thai flavor with a lychee aftertaste. There were unlimited toppings so it was a plus. The same person who was the cashier served me and gave generous amounts. Also, I had no idea there were unlimited toppings until after I paid and thought that I missed my opportunity.

Suggestions: Have a menu board that has the flavors and toppings in one place.
author: Jia Yi S.

description:
This place is pretty good and they have unlimited toppings. FOR. FREE. The only downside is that it takes so long and it gets super crowded with everyone sitting against the wall. 

Lastly, customer service is everything to me and I'm sure to many others. From my experience, the cashier and the person handling the toppings bar are the only two who interact with the customers. Don't make it obvious that you hate your job. Smile a little...
author: Julie Ann M.

description:
I'm confused why so many people are docking stars for the wait. You come here to order rolled ice cream. It takes time to roll ice cream - part of ordering here is getting to watch them make it right in front of you! And if that isn't what you're looking for, then there are tons of regular ice cream places you can go and get your normal rounded scoop in a cup (or cone) :)

That said, I really liked this place! I came here on a Saturday evening, and yes, there were a good 5+ people ahead of me, so I had to wait. Nonetheless not *quite* 5 stars from me mostly because of the price, but it was fun watching all the different flavors being prepared, and plan out how many of the (freeeee) toppings I wanted.

The layout is awkward and you're kind of funneled into the corner to watch them roll ice cream, or up by the window with some limited seating by the cashier. 

Notes:

- Everyone will have their phones out to video the rolling process. It's like you're in a mosh pit but without all the sweat.

- Friendly service from the cashier and topping-adding server! Our server was particularly creative and did very nice (read: Instagram-able) designs with our topping choices. Courteous and friendly.

- Ice cream rollers appeared to be the strong, silent type. Focused and doing their thing. Also probably avoiding eye contact with all the videographers.

- The ice cream will be practically solid once you get it. So enjoy taking photos with it for a bit to let it soften up before digging in.

I'm coming back for sure!
author: Vicky F.

description: Finally a place in the sunset district that sells rolled ice cream! Yay! It's nice that it's right across from Andronicos market and there's some parking near by. You walk in and the register is in front and you order right away. The first time I came here, I was a bit lost and the cashier girl was kind of rude tbh. She kind of gave my boyfriend and I an attitude b/c we didn't know how to order but I just shook it off. I was like whatever lol. Anyways, I had the thai tea and lychee one which was okay. I didn't really like the mix and I really wanted the Matcha Mocha but they ran out that day. Anyways, this time around I came here with my friends and luckily I was able to order the Matcha Mocha!! It was so yummy!!! :D I am a BIG green tea ice cream fan so this one is the one to go. We ordered and we saw the guys making it and it's pretty fun to watch. When it's ready, they will call you up and you pick your toppings. It's pretty cool that they let you choose unlimited toppings! They have a bunch of toppings to pick from like condensed milk, chocolate syrup, pocky sticks, graham crackers etc. Too many to name! Anyways, the second time around I got a better experience and I will be back again to get my usual green tea!
author: Monica W.

description: Good stuff (picture worthy is what i mean lol) !! Hella long wait tho.. :( the ice cream tastes ordinary its more just for a picture in my opinion
author: JJ B.

description: Really nice small place. A good variety of ice creams. We ordered gimme smore. Funky monkey and master ube
author: Jolly M.

description: I came here over the weekend when they had their 6.50 special for the week. A good selection of flavors, I went with the mocha matcha. What I loved most was that after 20-25 mins, my ice cream wasn't melting. You can top it off with fruits and other toppings also like graham crackers, Oreos, pocky sticks. Tip: pay at the register and wait for your order. It took my group and I about half an hour on a Saturday afternoon. Wish it was a little more organized, other than that it's a 3.5 stars, rounded up to 4.
author: Emily L.

description: Got here on a Wednesday afternoon at 3:09 and waited an hour to get my ice cream roll. If you have time to waste go ahead and be my guest LOL. There was only two people rolling the ice cream and I saw so much cups on the table. Lots of kids here because it's right next to the school. I got the Cookie Monster and it was way to sweet for me I would just go back to icicles and get their rolled ice cream (way creamier). Toppings are unlimited however they give out very small portions. I wouldn't be returning because of the long wait. P.s they're hiring right now!
author: Tina C.

description: Came here  about a month ago with my nephew and his family. It was absolutely amazing.We had the cookie monster the three Berries the Chunky Monkey and the Strawberry cheesecake. Had to return with my husband and I had the regular size strawberry cheesecake with fresh strawberries, whole gram crackers, whipped cream, and strawberry sauce. My husband had the three times Berries with fresh strawberries sliced bananas and mixed nuts. We enjoyed it profusely. We even saved  a little for the dogs. We all enjoyed it immensely we will definitely be back.
author: Antonio D.

description: Oh man this was the best ice cream I have ever had and I have tried many many places. I had the funky monkey with lychee and strawberries. It was full of so much flavor. If you're a first timer like me at this place I would recommend funky monkey.. especially if you're a Nutella lover.
author: Navroop K.

description: This place is good, and it was my first time trying rolled ice cream. I came at around 1:30 on Tuesday, so there were not many people. It took around 10-15 minutes for me to get my ice cream as there were a few people before me. I ordered cookie monster, but they gave me funky monkey instead. I don't know why this happened, but it was okay since I wanted to try funky monkey anyways. The ice cream was good and I got a lot of toppings since it is unlimited.
author: Colette L.

description:
I went there last Wednesday sep. 27 th . The ice cream looked delicious, I ordered vanilla Oreo. I liked seeing the guy making the ice cream until  I saw his long hair moving around bending over the ice cream while he was rolling it. He wore this kind of cap that protects just the forehead and all his long hair was on the top of it moving everywhere around! 
Thank you for bacteria rolling ice-cream. I didn t dare to say something because it was crowded and I didn t want to make him uncomfortable . That was very disgusting.
I didn t eat my ice cream (of course) and threw it away right after I left. 
Come on guys! There is no boss, no manager to teach the employees about hygiene?
author: Me M.

description: Cool ice cream parlor with the trendy roll technique. I really enjoy that the toppings are free and unlimited. Although the parlor itself is quite small and crowded at rush hours, you'll definitely get a chance to get a video or view of the process of rolling the ice cream!
author: Daisy T.

description: Cookie Monster and Thai Chee (Thai tea lychee). Really creamy! It was about a 20 minute wait and got our ice cream after doing some grocery shopping across the street. Unlimited toppings and friendly staff! A wonderful addition to the sunset and a great replacement to J&J ice cream.
author: Joanna C.

description: Great place for some sweet treats really enjoyed getting toppings from one of the workers Nikko
author: Nikko D.

description:
The rolled ice cream was so satisfying!
I'll definitely go again! 
To me it was worth the trip!
author: Hnub H.

description: Sum good ass ice cream man. Could lower the prices especially when you bringing somebody cause goddam we gettin some ice cream. Not tryna spend like 15$ on it yasayin that's a full ass meal. But that shit smack af. I fucks with the vision.
author: Martin L.

description: This place was really worth the price. $7.05 for a regular with free and unlimited toppings. The flavors are really good, and especially the matcha if you like green tea. The rolls are really cool and very instagramable.
author: Colette M.

description: I love this place and it's definitely not too expensive for what you're asking for. For a small it's about $6 but unlimited topping! The place is rather small, nothing too big, so it can get really crowded sometimes. When I went on a Friday night it was packed, but on a Tuesday afternoon it was empty, so obviously it varies. Street parking only. The ice cream itself is so, SO creamy which is why I think I like it so much. This is one of my favorite ice cream places in the city and watching them make it/roll it makes it even better. They had great customer service and was also very kind.
author: Michelle V.

description: I honestly wasn't expecting this to be as good as It was. So for starters their logo is a dog, bonus points. It's also the type of dog I have, double bonus points. You go inside and order from the nice worker at the front who will give you a number. Then the magic happens. I got a mix of vanilla ice cream, banana, and Nutella. Hubby got vanilla ice cream and Oreo mix. The whole process of them making it is a bit detailed, so I'll just say the flavors were fresh and blended. If you wanna see, you'll have to go watch the magic for yourself. I was worried the ice cream would be icy, but it was actually really creamy. The blend of flavors mixed perfectly. Also, you can add as many toppings as you want. No limit on how many you add. All for the flat price of about $7 for everything. Waited a little bit but it was a sunny Saturday night, so that was expected. All in all, I'll be going back!
author: Brittany B.

description: I dnt usually give stuff this much credit but this place is super good deff worth the wait and the price I had strawberry cheesecake with lots of extra toppings and my boyfriend had Cookie Monster it was great deff will return
author: melisa r.

description:
Got the Cookie Monster- flavorful and I personally really like the texture! The wait on the other hand was insane... 

Waited for 30-40 mins, took less than 5 mins to devour.
author: Yanni C.

description:
When I walked in, there were a family with small child sat across a crazy man shouted something.  fortunately, they shoo him away when lot of costumer came. I didn't understand why they let this happen, bad first impression for me 
The ice cream also had a standard taste compare to their price The jar they keep all topping in is not clean.
author: Uni C.

description: Pretty tasty. The pricing is great considering they give you unlimited toppings. The line is always long but it's worth the wait.
author: Carmen C.

description: It's all a gimmick, the concept of rolled ice cream is cool and everything, but I don't know why I thought that I can pick up a roll of ice cream and eat it as a roll. It's basically ice cream designed in a different way, just like the scoop it's hard to push your plastic spoon in for the first bite. I love that this place has unlimited toppings, but still I don't think it's worth $7. The green tea ice cream was way too sweet and you can't even taste the green tea, it tasted like sweet milk with a lot of sugar. The rocky road was good, it was not too sweet and the marshmallows and nuts went perfectly with the chocolate ice cream. I would not come here again, I rather drive a few blocks to grab some gelato from Marco Polo, but it's a great place for food pictures.
author: Vivi T.

description:
Finally tried the Thai chee .... it was very light and yummy.   It's fun to watch them roll.... it is not fast.  Order, pay. Take your number and  ... go shopping at Andronicos or take a walk ....then come back.

It's worthy trying.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Awesome Ice Cream spot! They freeze liquid ice cream in front of you and scrap it into ice cream rolls. The result is a super dense ice cream. I love it! Prices are good and unlimited toppings is a nice touch. Try the Matcha ice cream with Strawberries, Blackberries, and Condensed Milk toppings!
author: John C.

description: Move over Smitten! There's a new ice cream in town and it is AMAZING! Thank goodness I don't live nearby or there would be a problem for me! I've only had the Rocky Roll and it was fantastic! We ordered a large and shared but wish I would have gotten my own! Unlimited toppings and the staff was uber friendly! We were the last customers they served a few minutes before 10p and they were not bothered by our last minute visit. Thanks guys for the deliciously dense rolled ice cream...we can't wait to come back!
author: MaryFrances A.

description: First time been here, saw this friend Facebook. Finally find a time to try this spot. Yummy
author: Yueming G.

description: Finally tried this kind of ice cream after seeing it all over YouTube. I ordered the matcha flavor but didn't taste any matcha.... the only good part was the unlimited toppings. Its $7 for a regular one. The star has to be the ice cream and it's not found here. The line was long, waited 20 minutes. I still prefer Polly Anns.
author: U L.

description: I had the funky monkey: banana and nutella (with strawberries). I wasn't sure what to order so gave into what I already knew would be good. It was good. Can't say the same for the rest of my group. One ordered Thai tea. It was also good. I'd say mines was the best! Very packed place, rude customers, they just cut in line and act like you're invisible so watch out. Long wait, but worth the buy. Line easily goes out the door and onto the sidewalk.
author: Eva B.

description: I've always wanted to try one of these roll-style ice cream places and was super excited to see one near me on Yelp while trying to kill time. Unfortunately, it did not live up to the hype...well, at least this place. Not worth it. Everything is $7.05 (including tax) as of now. We opted for the "Thai Chee", which is supposed to be a fusion of Thai tea and lychee ice cream. It had good creamy texture, but it was basically orange-colored lychee ice cream...didn't taste Thai tea at all. You get unlimited toppings like whipped cream, pocky, cookie straws, Oreos, fruit, etc., but I still don't think it's worth over $7.
author: Stephanie G.

description: Yummy new way to eat ice cream! Small and no tables just benches. But it was a nice way to experience ice cream.
author: Monique G.

description: Very friendly staff and absolutely fun and delicious ice cream experience! You cannot miss this little gem!!!!!
author: Carly H.

description: This place isn't bad! A "different kind" of ice-cream experience, but still a good one nonetheless. Toppings are unlimited after yours is made, so i think this explains why the price is a little steep. You can sit around on the benches inside if you want to enjoy your dessert, but once it gets crowded all you'll see are people's backs in front of you.
author: Mertani G.

description: My new go-to spot! I thought the rolled up ice cream thing was a cute hype, but I wasn't all that interested until I tried it for myself. Everything tastes so fresh and it's cool watching it being made while you wait. Plus, the toppings are free and unlimited!
author: Lariza E.

description: This place is pretty good. If you see a crowd of people inside on your left, they're waiting for their ice cream and trying to watch the workers roll them (I got confused the first time and thought they were in line since it went out the door). The cashier station is usually open right when you walk in. I've been here twice, but the downside was that I waited at least 40 minutes both times. I tried Thai Chee for my first time there and it was really good! They poured their Thai tea cream and mixed in whole lychee pieces in it. If Thai and Lychee is your two favorite things then you'll definitely have a strong taste from both flavors. The next one I tasted was Master Ube (purple yam and vanilla).  I definitely recommending topping it with Oreos and Condensed milk. Overall I'd come back here again when the crowd dies down so there's less of a wait time. For those of you with a nut allergy, their Funky Monkey contains Nutella. So they actually squirt a whole bunch of Nutella on the freezing plate to mix. There is no separate nut free freezing plate to make your rolls so be careful if you're really sensitive.
author: Amelia H.

description: I have only had the matcha green tea and I really enjoyed it. I wish they had a menu of recommended combos. I'm not a fan of unlimited toppings. I like the option but I also respect when a place knows what items complement their products well. I felt like the portion was rather large, even though many people think the opposite. I'm just not the big-bowl-of-ice-cream type of person. There's only one size, so I'm not sure how often I'd return.
author: Elsie M.

description: 1 out of the 3 flavors I got was good. The other 2 were okay. I think it's called the triple berry. Highly recommend that one. The reason we went was to get the taro flavored one but they ran out.
author: Michael M.

description: Great concept and presentation of ice cream. Lines a little long but worth waiting. Many flavors and toppings to choose from.
author: Tommy A.

description: I went in today for my first ever rolled ice cream! They are very nice and were patient with me as I tried to decide what to have. I had the Funky Monkey...I think that's what it was called! The ice cream base was perfectly creamy and sweet. He added in a half a banana and a spoonful of Nutella...yum! Then did his "thing" mixing it together and getting it frozen. Then rolled in to about 6 rolls that he perfectly fit in to the bowl. Lots of topping choices included. It was soooo yummy with the fresh banana now frozen and mixed in perfectly. I will be back!
author: Leslie S.

description: First time here and waited for an hour and 5 mins for my order. It's not worth the wait. The place is just like cold stone ice cream but less sweet. Pricing wise is $6.50 w/ free toppings.
author: Mary T.

description: If you want to wait 30 minutes for a small cup of ice cream that tastes pretty ordinary and costs over $7, this is the place! Not for me, no thank you, will not be returning.
author: Monica C.

description: I came here with my sister and her friend. The service here wasn't that great. There was about 6 people standing behind the counter and only one person worked on our order. After I got my order someone else joined in to make the ice cream. I personally feel bad giving 2 stars. I got the matcha-Cha flavored and it was a little too sweet for me and didn't taste much like matcha. My sister got the Thai-Chee and she didn't like it. If you like lychee you probably will but if you're looking to have something that taste more like Thai tea that flavor is not for you. Lastly, her friend got a strawberry cheesecake flavor and that was pretty good. Pricey for the quality. I didn't think it was worth it. On the plus side they let you choose your own unlimited toppings
author: Cynthia L.

description:
Rolled in on a Friday night around 8pm. The line was out the door but it didn't take long to get to the counter. We ordered a 3x berries, rocky roll, and s'mores. As other reviewers have already described, it's pretty fun to watch them make your order. First they measure out the "base", pour it into the well and mash in the flavor components (e.g., berries, graham crackers). You can see the base start to freeze as they mix everything together. Then they spread it out in a thin layer and scrape long ribbons into "rolls" of ice cream that they arrange into a cup. You can add whatever you want on top-- they have a selection of nuts, fruits, crunchies, and sauces. 

We liked all our ice creams. The best was probably the 3x berries, but the other two were excellent as well. When we come back, we'd ideally like to try their thai tea and machta bases. 

It seems as though perhaps they've started offering another size-- a small, for about $5, and a regular size for $7ish. The small was definitely enough to share between two people for an after dinner dessert. 

Another great addition to the inner sunset frozen treat scene!
author: T K.

description: So delicious! You're allowed to choose as many toppings as you'd like without charge. Do expect to wait a good 25 mins for your rolled ice cream though. With them being a new business, I'll let them slide with the wait time but hopefully within the month, service will be quicker. :)
author: Katie W.

description: I love this place so much!! Me and my best friend come here all the time, it's so yummy
author: Danah H.

description: This place is so disorganized.  You walk in and you expect someone to be at the register to take your order. NOPE! I was standing at the register for a while. No acknowledgement from any of the workers. None of them seem to even care. Decided to walk down the block to San Francisco Creamery instead!
author: Stephanie L.

description: I saw rolled ice cream on YouTube and couldn't find a place near me. I saw this place across from a super market and wanted to try it. Really good and cute but it's really pricey. And, it has no tables to eat and they opened 20 minutes late. On a good note I had Funky Monkey and now I wish I could make this at home
author: Karina M.

description: Best place to get rolled ice cream! Unlike most shops I've been to, this is the only that allows UNLIMITED toppings from numerous to choose from! I tried the strawberry cheesecake and Cookie Monster with my man. SOO DELICIOUS! Definitely worth waiting the long line. Keep in mind, that the store is pretty small. I went at an hour before closing time and it was too crowded to the point where we were shoulder to shoulder while others were waiting outside. But, despite the long lines time went by pretty quick when waiting on our ice cream! Definitely recommend and will come again!
author: Chris B.

description: Our 1st visit today and we will definitely be back! My girls ordered Nutella & Banana and Thai tea with Lychee. They both absolutely loved it. Comes with all the toppings you want. They chose whip cream, chocolate sprinkles and bananas. Such a unique twist on ice cream and it's fun to watch them mix and roll them up
author: Lea G.

description: We went in on Tuesday to with high expectations from all the hype for rolled ice cream but left feeling a little ripped off. The ice cream tasted very much like regular ice cream but left us  waiting for 20 minutes with two orders ahead of us. Giving an extra star for their effort and kind service but I just can't justify how our cup of ice cream that taste so normal costed us $7.
author: Crystina L.

description: This has to be the worst thing to ever happen to ice cream. The ice cream is chewy and toppings do not stay in the cup and pretty much decided it's inedible.
author: James T.

description: Small place but worked fast and lots of options. Way creamier than I was expecting and not icy at all.
author: Colin F.

description: Getting your order will take soooo long that the rolled ice cream fad will be over by the time you take your first bite.  We wanted dessert after having a nice Saturday lunch at San Tungs so we decided to try the rolled ice cream craze.  We waited 57 minutes for ice cream!  I can't believe we waited this long.  We should have asked for our money back after 15 min.  They should really disclose how long you have to wait for your order to be completed.  Our wait for San Tungs was only 5 min! SMH.  The ice cream was creamy but I would never wait more than 5 min. for rolled ice cream.  You're better off finding another ice cream scoop place.  Waste of time!!!! It's not worth it. One star for wait time and lack of space to sit and eat your ice cream when you actually get it.
author: Leen B.

description: First time going to a rolled ice cream shop, and it is definitely worth it! The staff was extremely friendly and seeing your ice cream being made was awesome. The ice cream itself tasted really creamy and delicious.
author: Amy T.

description: Ask cashier how long the wait is.  We waited 1 hour.  Ice cream was good cuz hard.
author: Alex K.

description:
This was such a great dessert! Having free toppings and being able to see the rolled ice cream be made is such a great experience. I totally recommend. 

The funky monkey is a great choice if you ever visit.
author: Nicholas H.

description: Yummy ice cream and very nice service!!!! A little busy but don't let the line scare you!
author: Kevin T.

description: Sub par ice cream that was completely over frozen leaving a freezer burn taste and tasted like nothing but the cream (base) they used. The wait was absolutely horrendous and took over an hour and a half! The store was also super hot and unbearable to wait for your ice cream in. You're better off going to the grocery store next door to get a tub for $4.99 and throwing some strawberries on it! Very overrated for me. But was an experience that won't be forgotten.
author: Maya P.

description: We came here on a whim and we sure were glad we did. The ice cream was great and the flavors to choose from were awesome. I had the Strawberry Cheesecake and I would totally get that again. My Hubby actually requested something not on the menu and they were very happy to do it for him. Watching them make it was fun and very interesting. We will be coming back here again soon
author: Lynn R.

description: My first time trying rolled ice cream! Was really good and cool. You pick the ice cream flavor and you get unlimited toppings.
author: Daisy S.

description: Good stuff. Ignore the haters. Well worth the wait! Cookie Monster with extra Oreos and raspberries. Equals yum yum.
author: Joshua R.

description: This was a great experience. If you've never tried rolled ice cream, you must. They make your individual order from scratch--meaning they start out with a cup of cream. You can watch them make it. They pour the cream and whatever ingredients you order onto a super cooled pan, mix it up, and flatten it out.  It freezes, they scrape it off (into rolls), & put it in a dish. You have your choice of about 20 different free toppings and then they serve it to you.  It's delicious!  Please be aware, however, that since every order is custom made from scratch, you need to allow 15 to 20 minutes (if it's not too crowded) between ordering and being served ice cream. But it's well worth the wait!
author: Jay Y.

description: It's fun watching how they make your ice cream and it does tastes good. But there is a long line
author: Cathy L.

description: I like their Cookie Monster. It is hand-made ice cream but it tastes good. I eat twice a week.
author: Reiner C.

description: Fantastic ice cream and service! Thick and creamy ice cream, expertly rolled. $5.42 for a small, all toppings included. Got the banana Nutella (so yummy!) They were very kind and accommodating about my gluten allergy - cleaned off an ice cream station and changed gloves to prevent contamination. Thank you!!
author: Katie B.

description: Terrific ice cream, really nice front counter customer service, fun for kids to watch the process, albeit a little cramped inside.  Definitely worth a try!  My only complaint ... please ask the young lady with the very long ponytail to tie it up because every time she turned around, the bottom of her hair would touch the ice cream waiting for toppings.  I'm sure she didn't know it, but it's not very appetizing to watch.  Hair nets?!  Just kidding, but maybe a bun couldn't hurt.
author: G. M.

description: Fun to choose your ice cream flavour and watch them create and roll it up in front of you eyes! I got the Thai tea flavor, which had the pretty tea coloring, however it did not taste like Thai tea. It's pretty cool that you can choose as many toppings as you like without additional cost and they arrange the toppings so that it looks pretty and presentable for your photos! Long wait though since everybody wants to get in on the hype.
author: Angel G.

description: This place is great if you have an hour window in your day that you can solely dedicate to getting ice cream.... The ice cream itself is good, but nothing special. The service and wait on the other hand was atrocious. Paint drys faster than these people work. Everything they do is in slow motion. I'm willing to cut them some slack though, because overall they looked like a rather young staff. Nonetheless, an hour long wait for some ice cream is absolutely ridiculous. Let's Roll could improve by picking up the speed and finding a way to be more efficient with their service.
author: Nick N.

description: I'm sorry but this place is just not worth the wait. It was my second time coming here and I waited much longer than I did the first time. I waited 30 mins the first time and this time I waited 45 mins. I also waited an extra 10 mins because they still weren't open even though it was already 1. They should also have more people make the ice cream because they literally only make one order at a time. The ice cream isn't bad but it isn't amazing either. I won't be returning unless they find a way to get the orders out quicker because 45 mins for just one order of ice cream is ridiculous.
author: Cee H.

description:
So this was my second time getting a Let's Roll Ice Cream. Decided to bring my family to try it, since the first time I ordered the Thai Chee and thought it was really good.  This time we ordered the Matcha-cha (regular sized, the larger of the two sizes) and the Thai Chee again. 

As the guy was making the matcha roll, he sloppily puts all but one roll into the cup. There was one more roll left on the cold plate.  Thought he would easily adjust the position of the rolls to fit the last roll. But no...he picks up the perfectly good roll and throws it away! Right in front of us! Basically, he made a sloppy "small" sized cup but I got charged for the larger size ($7). The guy should know, as in any business that you prepare someone's meal or dessert in front of the receiving patron, you should never discard a good piece (it wasn't "extra" either) that is owed to the consumer. In fact, they always "pre-measure" the cream mixture in a cup beforehand, so it is not like he made too much. When I started eating my ice cream, I noticed the center roll was really thin and half was missing (probably an edge of an incomplete roll), so there was a good empty space in the center. 

I regret tipping them now....but my fault since I tipped before he made my ice cream roll. Very disappointed since I didn't get what I paid for. Sorry, I really don't like giving negative reviews, but for the high price and for ditching my last roll, minus 3 stars.
author: Kimmie G.

description: They are clueless.. make sure you have one and order at the checkout before waiting in their 30 MINUTE LINE!!!! There is a tiny sign hidden by the register and that's the only way you know not to hop in line like everyone so eagerly waiting (to see their ice cream made not order) either way I got to the front to be laughed at and told sorry you need to order over there and get in the back of the 30 minute line again.. you've got to be kidding me!! They were rude and wouldn't give me any consideration for having waited for nothing. I've never written a review but am letting my dinner get cold to make sure everyone knows this place is not worth your business. And I saw the host reach in her pants before topping someone's ice cream - ew!
author: John B.

description: it's just okay. super sweet. not for me especially when you need to wait 30mi minutes or more for your order.
author: James P.

description: This is one of my new favorite spots. Great customer service and wait time isn't to crazy. Ice cream is good too.
author: Vanessa R.

description: The ice cream is okay, but nothing special.  The process of making the rolls - spreading the melted ice cream onto a frozen surface, then scraping the thin layers into rolls which are then stacked vertically into a cup - is, first, tediously time consuming, and second, changes the lovely smooth creaminess into a very cold flaky structure which only becomes edible when it melts a bit.  Plus it's VERY expensive, $7.05, for a smallish cup.  This feels like a gimmick, a fad with a short life.  I hope the hard working folks doing the scraping don't get wrist injuries.
author: Betty K.

description: This place is small with not much seating. The idea is great and this place is good to try. I live on the other side of the park, so I don't think I would come often, but totally give it a try. Staff is friendly and there a a lot of choices for flavors/toppings.
author: Shaneel A.

description: This place takes 20-30 minutes to make a "cup" of ice cream, then too hard to eat. When you do eat it, it doesn't taste like anything special.. Just cold milk with some toppings shoved in it. Cool concept, poor execution.
author: Heather B.

description: It was okay. Moved here to SF for work and co-workers invited me to try this ice cream shop. I tried it for the hyped but it was alright.
author: Jake P.

description: As a vegetarian, the presence of bacon bits in an ice cream parlor is a total turn off. I don't want to find a stray piece of bacon in my strawberry ice cream. Yuk!
author: Ritch G.

description: Two stars mainly due to the fact that they offer one size at a relatively high price of 7-8 dollars. Tastes good, but not so good that it would make me go again and wait for 20min
author: Marc A.

description: I love the new concept but the waiting line was so long. Waiting more than a half hour to get the ice cream, not worth it. Moreover, the ice cream tasted so ordinary.
author: Kate L.

description: Just had this 5 minutes ago with my boyfriend. I had the Nutella and banana and he had the cookies and cream. The place has unlimited toppings including the stick wafers and pocky. We waited about 5 minutes in line and 25 minutes overall for our ice cream. Since it was so packed there was hardly any space but we still scored some seats by the window. The ice cream was alright nothing special about it other than the fact it was rolled. They run out of toppings as well as the ice cream too. Overall it was okay and I'd probably come back again.
author: Maureen M.

description: What made this popular... the hype? No! This place is in and of itself the future of ice cream making. Though traditional ice cream by the scoop is still nice, if you want to try something new, this is the place to go. Ice cream that is made from liquid to a solid in just seconds is incredible. The possibilities of flavor profiles are endless! Though the price point can be a bit cheaper, it's still pretty fair considering the amount they give you and, don't forget, the UNLIMITED topping!!!
author: Brian N.

description: The line was long, but that's expected of a new business, especially with the kind of ice cream they have! The ice cream tasted AND looked GREAT! Im excited to have this new ice cream shop in my neighborhood. Definitely worth the wait.
author: Steven C.

description: It's a cool experience, and the flavors are very cool and interesting. I've come three times and tried the cookies and cream, the thai-chee, and the regular green tea ice cream. The wait is insanely long during busy hours! The ice cream itself is kind of hard when you get it, but it melts pretty fast. It's kind of basic ice cream, it doesn't taste like $7 worth, but it's definitely for the culinary experience of watching it be made.
author: Emily Y.

description: I'm going to be honest. I waited about 20 min for my ice cream. I think it's cuz it's made from scratch in front of u though. And they did just open so there are more people. The ice green tea ice cream rolls I got tasted like average green tea flavor ice cream from grocery store. Not authentic tasting at all. Im interested to try the Thai tea one but I probably wouldn't go back because it's so expensive. Besides this, the staff is great.
author: Nahal S.
